{{also|ein|-ein|EIN|éin}} ==German== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|[ʔaɪ̯n]}} * {{audio|de|De-ein-.ogg|Audio}} ===Etymology 1=== {{inh|de|gmh|īn-}}, a variation of the preposition {{m|de|in}}, from {{der|de|goh|in}}, from {{der|de|gem-pro|*in}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*h₁én}}. Compare {{cog|en|in-}}. ====Prefix==== {{de-pref}} # {{ngd|prefix, usually indicating (concrete or abstract/metaphorical) motion into something}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|aus-}} ===Etymology 2=== Combining form of {{m|de|eins|t=one}}. ====Prefix==== {{de-pref}} # [[one]], [[mono-]], [[uni-]] #: {{prefixusex|de|Bein|-ig|einbeinig|t1=leg|t3=one-legged}} ====Derived terms==== {{prefixsee|de}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} * {{R:DWDS}} {{topics|de|One}} ---- ==Icelandic== ===Prefix=== {{head|is|prefix}} # [[mono-]], [[uni-]], [[one]] ====Derived terms==== {{prefixsee|is}} * {{l|is|einarma}} ====See also==== * [[Ein-]] (a {{m|is|forliður||first element of a compound word}} for Icelandic personal names; [[Einar]], [[Einbjörn]], [[Einvarður]]) * [[tví-]] * [[þrí-]]
